description: The story takes place after 90 percent of humanity wiped out due to an invasion. Survivors live in a shelter where their lives are monitored, and memories of the invasion erased. Three teenagers from the shelter are chosen to pilot three machines that combine to form the Musashi robot, made out of a material named Megatronium alloy. The series will balance robot action with school life.
hashtag: #メガトン級ムサシ #アニメムサシ

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%A5%BF%E9%83%B7%E6%86%B2%E4%B8%80%E9%83%8E)

**Kenichirou Saigou** is a composer affiliated with Level-5.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AkihiroHino)

A video game designer. Started his career as a programmer in the late '80s, and later took on roles in writing, designing, directing and producing. In 1998, he founded Level-5, a Japanese video game studio, where he remains its president and CEO.

Known for titles such as Dark Cloud, Dark Chronicle, Inazuma Eleven and Professor Layton.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AkihiroHino)

A video game designer. Started his career as a programmer in the late '80s, and later took on roles in writing, designing, directing and producing. In 1998, he founded Level-5, a Japanese video game studio, where he remains its president and CEO.

Animation Producer affiliated with [OLM](https://anilist.co/studio/28/OLM). Formerly affiliated with [Studio Gokumi](https://anilist.co/studio/418/Studio-Gokumi)
